ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport

ReviewText: First room had an air conditioner that was not cooling and a damp floor. Second room had TV remote that did not work and bedspread was ruffled (looked like someone was laying on bed before we arrived). Third room had loud air conditioner, but best of three rooms, so there we stayed.

ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport

ReviewText: Check in was easy. Staff were friendly. Free breakfast was average. Room was average. Car parking was free. Property definitely needs updating however. Gym was basic. It was a satisfactory stay for 1 night.
ReviewTitle: Overnight after flying in to Houston

ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport
ProviderLocation: 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2317 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2317
ReviewText: This was the second time we stayed at the Hampton airport hotel in Houston. It is a clean and standard level hotel in the Hilton family near the international airport and with free shuttle service. You have free WiFi, free breakfast (simpler version) and a complimentary wine and snack in the early evening. But all of that is not what makes this hotel so good. It is the service that the personell is giving you that puts a smile on your face! They are not only positive in their attitude, helpful whenever you need something and accommodating when you need a problem to be solved. They help you equally as nicely when you have already checked out! How is that for an airport hotel? We asked if they could keep our suitcase for ten days as we were traveling with back packs to Costa Rica. No problem for the Hampton Inn. They kept our suitcase and even helped us with some clothes that needed cleaning while we were gone. As we returned to catch a flight out of Houston, they had everything arranged for us with the suitcase and the cleaned clothes.

ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport
ProviderLocation: 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2317 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2317
ReviewText: While this hotel is convent, there are no restaurants near by, except for a fast food, and hotel shuttle does not offer shuttle service. Evening reception offered beer and wine as well as wings and meatballs. Also cops were offered.

ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport
ProviderLocation: 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2317 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2317
ReviewText: Checked in for one night and a couple of hours, great and fast shuttle service you are literally 5 minutes away from the airport, check in around midnight and Amyn from the Front desk was flawless and great, he knew the benefits for us HHonors and everything. Wake up call was done on time and the room was big, comfy and clean. Great free breakfast and wifi. Eventhough i stayed for just a couple of hours it was very nice.

ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport
ProviderLocation: 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2317 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2317
ReviewText: I always stay at a Hampton inn whenever possible. The staff is super helpful and friendly. The free shuttle service to and from the airport prompt, friendly, & helpful. Customer service is number one at this location.

ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport
ProviderLocation: 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2317 15831 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2317
ReviewText: Stayed in rm121. Could clearly hear shower running in room above. Toilet above was louder than a small jet taking off from airport when flushed. Unfortunately the people in room above arrived late and departed early. Mattress was an inexpensive bottom of the line set. Could literally feel the coils. Room was clean,staff very friendly and helpful. This was a handicapped room, don't know why they put me in here I didn't need. This room was definitely not up to the Hampton standards I'm used to. Will give three stars because of staff.

ProviderName: Hampton Inn & Suites Houston-Bush Intercontinental Airport

ReviewText: Checked in at 11:45 pm and had to leave at 6:00 am. While the room was clean, the cable TV - perhaps the most simple aspect of a room - did not work. I called the front desk, not 7 mins after arriving and no one answered. i was too tired to walk down and lodge a complaint.
ReviewTitle: Hotels are about consistent attention to detail - this Hampton FAILED.

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: I had the best experience at Lancaster, a wonderful stay! Staff was incredible, very attentive all the time. The hotel is in an excellent spot, and the room was amazing. I will definitely stay there next time I am in Houston!

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: Our stay at The Lancaster was amazing! The hotel is beautiful, very clean, and the staff was very friendly and professional (especially Russell). We were greeted with a glass of champagne, which set a wonderful tone to our arrival. Our room (5th floor) was very comfortable and quiet, with a great view. The bedding was superb! The breakfast buffet was very good!! We look forward to our next stay at The Lancaster!

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: We went the weekend before Valentines Day for a romantic getaway. We were not disappointed. The service from pulling up to the valet was superb. Attention to detail for the comfort of our stay was on point. Can't wait to get back!

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: From the time we walked in the doors our stay was fabulous. The Lancaster goes the extra mile to make you feel comfortable and welcome. Our king size suite was luxurious and a great romantic get away!

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: This is a late review. My husband and I continue to make the rounds in Houston. The Lancaster is an upscale boutique hotel with the best staff ever...hands down. I felt so welcome but not overwhelmed with "fake hospitality". These folks are genuine and Russell can read minds I think. This was an anniversary trip and I felt like they wanted to make sure we enjoyed it and had the romance experience as opposed to business or tourist. Loved everything...room, location, staff. We took a romantic stroll to the Aquarium for dinner and there was a festival going on so we had a little fun too. Stopped at the waterfall for pictures. Couldn't have asked for better!

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: Stayed here Sunday October 23rd till Monday October 24th. it was my last stop before jumping on a plane to New Zealand and then heading home to Australia, So all I wanted was a comfortable bed to sleep in before I started a 40 hour transit. A friend picked me up at Hobby Airport, We had dinner and I got to the hotel about 9pm. I met the infamous Russell, And I agree....he's amazing! After asking me to take a seat and some funny jokes and anecdotes about Australia (Bravo you certainly know your history!) this convict descendant was then issued his room key. So up I go to Room 1003. The room was amazing, I felt as if I was staying in a room from back in colonial times but with modern twists. The bed was amazing, Decent size room, Nice couch, Bathroom was spacious with Gilchrist & Soames toiletries , Shower/Tub combination. Nice LCD tv and the air conditioning working well since that particular day was warm. View was decent of the downtown area. I collapsed into bed and it was very comfortable, The next morning I got up, Showered and headed down to breakfast. This is where the experience soured a little...So Russell had told me breakfast was served on the 2nd floor (???) I remember it was just above the lobby, Anyway so I got out of the elevator and immediately notice people sitting at tables, So I wait thinking someone will come seat me....Waiting...Waiting.... And as I try to flag attention of staff member she ignores me and keeps walking. So I decide to just grab some cereal , Make my own coffee and sit down, Finish the meal, stand up and go to walk away and notice same staff member glaring at me.....Maybe she was upset I didn't tip her (But why should I if I got no service??) but maybe clearer interaction for staff and guests could be something to think about, I could of been anyone who walked off the street since they didn't check. Apart from that though check out went smoothly and my friend picked me up for a full day of exploring before my 9pm flight to Auckland. Will stay again if back in downtown Houston.
ReviewTitle: Amazing except for one slight experience

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: We went to Houston for our anniversary so we could see Book of Mormon at the Hobby Center. We stayed at the Lancaster for the first time. All employees were very kind, especially Russell Casanovas, the concierge in the evening. He couldn't do enough for us and was quite generous with his time and opinions on where to eat and what to see. The room was small but well-appointed and the bed was comfortable. Highly recommended.

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: This must be what hotels were like before the advent of chains. This privately owned historic landmark retains its charm, situated in the theatre district and not far from the museum district. The hotel's shuttle service will get you to all the museums, and there are theatres literally across the street. The rooms are impeccably clean. My king room was small but well-appointed. The heating/cooling system, which can be a problem in older buildings, is first-rate, and the staff were all friendly and professional. A free breakfast buffet, nicely laid out, goes with the deal. No complaints here.

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: The Lancaster is located within the theatre district of downtown Houston. The hotel excels in making their guests feel like they are welcomed. The rooms are well appointed - with big comfortable beds. The free wifi is fast. The free breakfast was from a menu. I would have preferred if the breakfast was a buffet. The valet parking was good value - $20 per day, allowing you to come and go.
ReviewTitle: It is number one for a reason

ProviderLocation: 701 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-2712 701 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-2712
ReviewText: I just decided to drop in for an overnight stay. Mr.Russel was my advisor for the night. Pleasant atmosphere, great room. All around from the entry to the front desk to the tour of my room. I'm very pleased with The Lancaster. Thanks again Russel
ReviewTitle: 1st time won't be the last time

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: When my husband and I have a night to run away, we always go to Hotel Granduca. It is a beautiful relaxing home away from home. Their service and attention to detail is outstanding. We absolutely feel they are the perfect place to get away and recharge. It is as though you are a million miles away in a beautiful Italian hotel.

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: The main reason for the low scores were with regards to the extremely slow & unorganized service at the restaurant on Valetines Day evening. With it being such a special evening and the amount of money spent, we were highly dissappointed in the dining service. It took us more than 3.5 hours to get through a dinner for 2 people. The kitchen forgot the 2nd course of our 4 course meal and we ended up skipping the 4th course as it was so late by that time. We purchased the package the hotel advertised for Valentines Day and the wait staff was confused as to what this package was and what was to come with our meal. After 2 waiters going back and forth to the kitchen or front desk for over an hour, they finally began to serve us our cocktails. We consistently heard other guests complaining about the slow service and not getting what they paid for throughout the night. Again, with the amount of money spent at this establishment, it was absolutely unexceptable for the dining service to be this ridiculous. We would not dine at the Granduca Hotel ever again.

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: Unique rustic Italian decor coupled with luxurious bedding made this hotel a great place to relax on vacation. Room service was delicous and a great experience overall. Only downfall is there is no self parking and valet parking is $28 a night however, I would recommend for anyone looking for a high quality stay with great service.

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: I'm not sure what we were expecting; the reviews were so glowing that perhaps we were all built up for something amazing which instead was nice but not over the top. The staff was pretty good although it took us a long time to get someone to wait on us for lunch (outdoor seating) - we had to ask twice for someone to get us menus and then had to go find someone to take our order. The rooms are a little dated but the thing that made us laugh a bit was the $28 per day valet parking which was right out front in their parking lot. We would ask for our car which we could see and easily have gotten ourselves, the valet would hustle over and grab the car and then we'd shell out a tip on top of it. Pretty funny but could be annoying to some people. Beware...

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: Hotel was 1st class Staff were amazing .Pool area was recently renovated looks great .When staff found out I was originally from Ireland had GM Martin also Irish come greet me He was very helpful with advice about Houston

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: Beautiful hotel, generous, extremely comfortable rooms. Very clean and updated. Food nearly decadent, staff friendly and helpful. Just an absolutely beautiful experience in an absolutely beautiful setting.

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: Since review of 2011, gave another chance. Huge improvements including top-notch staffing. Restaurant was under construction during latest visits. Has limited and delicious offerings. The main issue now is pricing. They have a membership sold to us on the basis of priority booking and four nights for the price of three. After over $1k joining, the 4 for 3 is during limited times, and earned free nights must be used other than at the site used. This is useless for a frequent medical patient. Also, watch out on pricing. Never given a flat rate quote and they go up every day - way up! Rooms are very quiet due to solid construction. No Fox Business nor Weather Channel but they have Bravo.

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: At least one International socket adaptors should be in each room putting people from Europe and Africa into consideration, the hotel and it's staffs are great always willing to assist to a comfortable stay.

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: Great hotel. Lovely room. Super friendly staff. When you are at the poolside you'd never know you were in the middle of a city, very relaxing. My only negative feedback was my room was beside a service room and staff were in and out throughout the night,or so it seemed.

ProviderLocation: 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston , TX 77056-3202 1080 Uptown Park Blvd , Houston, TX 77056-3202
ReviewText: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Granduca Houston on many occasions at all different times of the year. I've stayed for different lengths of time and also in most of the different types of rooms, if not all. Sometimes I are traveling on business and sometimes I stay there while I'm in town visiting my family. It is my home away from home! This fabulous boutique hotel is perfect for any occasion. Why I love it most: It is a luxurious establishment located right in the middle of "Uptown" Galleria area. This is a beautiful upscale area surrounded by some fabulous restaurants, shops, and even a couple of spas. The Galleria Mall is just a few blocks away! It is one of my favorite areas in Houston! The property itself is exquisite and decorated with the utmost discrimination and beautifully appointed. The restaurant is wonderful and so is the lounge area. I love to grab dinner or a drink and sit outside poolside on a nice evening. The pool area is gorgeous with lavish landscaping and lovely music piped outside. If you are lucky you will catch some live music right there at the lounge. I also enjoy the fact that i can stay at a luxurious hotel that accepts my pets so that they can travel along with me. The hotel is beautiful and very well cared for. Sometimes you will arrive at another hotel and your "pet room" smells just like what it is. But at Granduca, you will never encounter this problem. There is not a bad view from any room. Each room is exquisitely decorated and immaculately cleaned down to the finest detail. You will not be disappointed! Thank you to the fabulous Granduca staff that always greets me with a smile and hello! The service is bar none in all departments!
ReviewTitle: GRANDUCA HOUSTON - AN EXQUISITE LUXURY HOTEL

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: The hotel is grand and rather imposing, a huge drive up and a very large entrance hall. The guys at the valet parking seemed on the ball and efficient. If you are staying overnight the parking fees are $15. Receptionist was friendly and again efficient. Where this hotel lets itself down is the infrastructure. The elevators were rickety and the display broken so you did not know which floor you were on. The rooms were just tired, both the beds in our room 412 squeaked so bad if you moved that we woke up constantly through the night. The doors all have the old style slam locks on so again I was woken up constantly through the night with returning guests slamming doors, they were so bad the room actually shook when our neighbours returned. Bathroom is tiny, not enough room for 2, the faucet is rotten through use over the years, the bath empties even when sat in it with your foot on the plug hole. The shower head drips, there are a paint splatters on the walls etc, it's just tired tired. We had a view of the highway. We had breakfast in the restaurant, just good,nothing special at all, BLT with literally the smallest 2 slices of bacon in, had I been paying full price instead of the complimentary breakfast would have sent it back. All in all stay was a bit blah! Glad to be getting on the road this morning.
ReviewTitle: Ok stay but badly needs some TLC

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: Very nice and reasonable hotel. Staff were courteous, polite and very helpful. Location was great being so close to different sights and restaurants. The complementary shuttle bus was a major plus getting us around the area without having to drive and find parking. Wifi was free but you had to pay for parking, cost was not too painful.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: This hotel is perfectly located near the walking distance of the midtown bars and also really enjoyed dining at the patio bar outside "Part & Parcel" they have a nice selection of draft beers and outdoor music!

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: I went with my husband last month on a short notice business trip. We were able to get in without a hassle. The location is perfect for those who enjoy the city view and night life. We will definitely look in to this hotel for future business.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: We greatly enjoyed our experience here!!! The staff was amazing, not to mention the outdoor bar and indoor restaurant!! Delicious food and excellent drinks- and to curl up in a comfy bed, in a clean and well designed room was the icing on the cake!! We will defiantly be making this our downtown Houston get away!!

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: This is a very nice hotel with great restaurant and bar internally and friendly staff to ensure you have a nice stay. There is also close proximity to downtown destinations, sporting events, and some of the greatest bars and restaurants on Main Street and in midtown nearby. I highly recommend this hotel when visiting Houston
ReviewTitle: Excellent hotel and convenient for downtown destinations

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: This is my second time staying at the WhiteHall and it was great just like the first. The rooms are nice and have a homey modern feel to it. The light up mirror in the bathroom is nice. The beds are comfy and clean. They provide free cookies and water in the rooms which is great addition. I had a higher floor room that had good views of the downtown. This is unusual to say but worth mentioning that the soap/shampoo they have in the bathrooms is actually good, not many hotels get that right. Ashika and John were great hosts who recommended great places nearby to go out to, went to a bar that had turtle races haha. I would stay here again and recommend it.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: Hotel upgraded from the former CROWNE Plaza to independent boutique style hotel. Rooms have hardwood floors with great amenities. The staff from the restaurant, front office, concierge and valet is top notch. They really do a good job of remembering you and are extremely proactive. The graveyard crew is wonderful and knowledgable and gives many options on what to do at night. The concierge staff were also helpful. Love the outside bar area also. If your heading anywhere within the downtown area ask about their complimentary shuttle service. Runs till 11pm I believe.. Love this hotel and the staff.

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: Lovely hotel great staff could not have been more helpful the reception staff were outstanding the bar staff were great especially Heather the rooms were spacious and well equipped nothing was too much trouble
ReviewTitle: A week at the quilt festival

ProviderLocation: 1700 Smith Street , Houston, TX 77002 (Formerly Crowne Plaza Houston Downtown)
ReviewText: Room was over the top. Clean and so comfortable. Every employee that I had contact with had a smile on their face and were more than pleasant. Room service was fast and good. It was a good location and everyone was anxious to help with information.

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: I stayed for valentine's with my wife. I love everything about this hotel. Great rooms and great staff. I stopped at the bar for a few drinks. The bartender Guillermo suggested me the cocktail monalissa, it was amazing. He was very friendly and the bar is beautiful. It really was a great weekend.

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: Stayed at hotel sorella for a weekend vacation. This hotel is very nice! Complimentary breakfast was excellent. The bar monnalisa had live music and we had a great time. Guillermo was our bartender and he was great! City Centre had a lot to feature and a lot of activities as well. Would recommend this hotel to everyone!

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: Had a stay-cation with my husband for his birthday. We stayed two nights and it was awesome. Service was great, breakfast was nice and really felt like a Retreat away from the hustle and bustle of Houston life. Every person we came in contact with was amazing. Raphael our valet for our car service was quick, courteous and went the extra mile. I highly recommend this hotel. We parked our car and never had to drive anywhere because of the shops and entertainment that was within walking distance. The live music was also great at the Monalisa.

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: Spent Valentine's Day weekend here. The hotel's style modern and chic! Walkably close to restaurants and bars. Great getaway for couples! Large rain shower was a nice touch. The linens were soft and plush.

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: My husband and I had a weekend getaway and since we only had one night, we chose to stay close to home. The hotel is beautiful, located in the middle of great restaurants and shopping. There is a parking garage that connects the hotel that is free, which is rare in Houston. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. It was a quick easy check in and check out. The bed was so comfortable.....I felt like I was at home! We ate a leisure lunch, did a little shopping, took in a movie ending the evening with a great dinner and never moved our car! Highly recommend this hotel for a getaway!

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: Stayed at the hotel, had an amazing time had a few drinks at the bar Delfino, Patrick and JC were great to share stories with. Next day had an awesome breakfast .. Any one in town for a weekend I definetly recommend it!!!

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: My fiance and I were on the weekend trip to Houston for the weekend. We wanted to stay in the city and enjoy some quality together. Perfect hotel to stay in the area to shopping eating and drink. We had a terrific time with Mike Guillermo and Pat. We love the cocktails there at the bar by the pool.

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: This was our third or fourth visit. Always very nice and clean. It is walking to distance to restaurants, shops and entertainment. Eddie V's was excellent as usual! There is a wide variety of restaurants.

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: I stayed at Hotel Sorella the weekend of Februrary 27th to be near the City Centre area for a friend's birthday dinner. I booked my hotel the same day and requested a high floor. Once I arrived to City Centre I parked in the free garage which is connected to the hotel. I found that out after lugging my suitcase down 2 flights of stairs like a bag lady. My check in process went very smoothly and the my request for a high floor was met. The young lady who checked me in was very polite. There was a room rate error and she immediately fixed the issue. The room was AMAZING. I love the modern look with the wooden floors. The only down side to the wooden floors is that you can hear the people above you walking, especially in heels! I also liked the couch area which was very cozy. My window faced the courtyard of city center so I heard the live musician and I could see everything which was perfect. The bed was heaven in a wooden frame (which I did hit my shin on). It was sooo comfortable. And the pillows...the pillows :) I tried to Google where the mattress was from but it turns out its a custom made mattress, which I would like to own. The room was stocked with enough towels and amenities. I didn't have any issues at the hotel and I can honestly say this by far has been one of the best hotels I've stayed at. I wish the Valencia Group had more Sorellas. I've stayed at pricier hotels in Houston which were super pretentious (ahem, ZaZa) and I would have chosen Sorella over them all. This is my new hotel when I travel. Hands down the best! Thank you Valencia Group and the staff at Sorella.

ProviderLocation: 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston , TX 77024-1488 800 Sorella Ct , North Building , Houston, TX 77024-1488
ReviewText: I've stayed here a number of times for business travel. The hotel is very nice, the beds are comfortable, the shower is awesome, and the property amenities are awesome. The location is ideal if you ask me because I don't like driving to get something to eat after work, then having to drive back to the hotel. This is right in the "city center" and there are a LOT of places to eat within easy walking, so there's no need to go anywhere else at all (well, except to work).
ReviewTitle: Very nice place in a great location

ProviderLocation: 5701 Main St , Houston , TX 77005-1824 5701 Main St , Houston, TX 77005-1824
ReviewText: We stayed here for a weekend in March. We stayed in a Grand King room...basic hotel room. The bed was extremely comfortable with lucious sheets. Terry lined satin robes are in the rooms. There is nightly turn down with candle and chocolates. The pool was relaxing with plenty of room in the shade. Food and bar were good. The location is in the hotel district. You are in walking distance of art museum, science museum, Japanese garden, zoo, and Rice University. I would stay here next time I visit Houston.

ProviderLocation: 5701 Main St , Houston , TX 77005-1824 5701 Main St , Houston, TX 77005-1824
ReviewText: Awesome experience. Customer Service was great. The desk manager Katherine was amazing and helpful. If you stay ask for her personally. First time to stay at a boutique hotel. Rooms were great and it is in a great location by the zoo and Rice University. Great restaurant on site
ReviewTitle: Celebrated my wifes Birthday with a staycation. First time to stay at ZAZA

ProviderLocation: 5701 Main St , Houston , TX 77005-1824 5701 Main St , Houston, TX 77005-1824
ReviewText: My wife and I came to Hotel Zaza in Houston to spend our 1st year anniversary together and we immediately fell in love with the ambience. My biggest compliment would have to go to Katherine at the front desk. She was so awesome and made our stay amazing. She provided top-notch customer service and catered to our every need. ReviewText: Hello, So this stay is everything you would expect out of a luxury hotel. The rooms were a little small but they were still very nice. The employees that worked in valet, housekeeping, room service, concierge desk and at the hotel shuttle service were exceptional! There was one young man at the front desk that checked me out that was really good as well. I enjoyed my stay because of them. However their are some areas that need improvement. I called the hotel about three times before my stay to ask questions so I could be prepared before I got there. The three times I called the person on the phone seemed annoyed by my questions. I booked my stay on trip advisor and its was my first time using a third party to book my hotel reservations. The second time I called I asked about any extra fees that I may need to be prepared to pay. I was transferred to reservations and they told me since I had booked on trip advisor whatever fee I was charged on the site should be all I needed. I was like ok because I know most hotels like this charge fees for every night you stay to cover any charges you might make, the incidental fee. I made sure I had about 100 extra plus my room fee and gas money just in case. After an 8 hour and 30 minute drive I rolled into the hotel excited about my stay, I was going to see the Beyonce concert the next day. I'm in Texas working on special assignment with my job until January and I also wanted to see more of what the state had to offer. Upon arrival I was told that because I was paying with my debit card that had I had to pay a $200 incidental fee up front. I told the young lady that I called ahead about extra fees and I wasn't told about this. I told her I only had a little over $600 on my debit card and that I could transfer the room fee over to one of my credit cards to get around the debit card upfront charge. She went and got the manger that was working that night. They both come out and the manger said because she said your really nice we are going to charge you for the stay on your card tonight and you can give us another card for your incidentals. I was like if I give you a credit card will I still need to pay the $200 fee upfront she said yes. I was confused because I thought I needed to pay the fee upfront because I was paying with a debit card. I was panicking inside trying to figure out what I could do because I wasn't going to have any extra money until I was paid on Friday. While I was thinking the manger started asking was I excited for the concert. I was like well I was and she proceeded to tell me that she could have told me me no that that would accept my card. She also added that my rooms were really discounted and I got a bunch of extra stuff since I booked on trip advisor. I was taken aback. Who in there right mind is going to to be excited for a concert when they are faced with the possibility that they won't have anywhere to stay for the next three days. The way she spoke to me was like I should be grateful that I even had the opportunity to stay there. How dare you! I agreed to letting them put the room balance on my card and using another card for my incidentals. The young lady said she tried to run my card twice and it wouldn't go through. I called my bank and talked to them and they said there was never an attempt to run my card made. I walked back up to the desk and told the young lady what my bank had said while they were on the phone and miraculously my card worked. I was calling bull crap on that one. I don't believe she ever ran it like my bank said. While I had my bank on the phone I told them what was happening and they agreed to raise the credit limit on a credit card I had with them so that I didn't have to use my spending money on the incidentals. So it worked out in the end but that whole check in experience pissed me off since I had called to inquire about extra fees and the way the manger talked to me was out of line. I would love to say I would stay here again but I probably won't because of this incident.

ReviewText: The Hilton Americas is truly a major, world-class hotel. It did remind us of the Frankfurt Hilton in layout and ambience. We received a warm welcome at the check-in. They do offer less expensive self-parking. It was so busy the night that we were there that we could not easily gain access to the restaurant or the lobby bar... but this is Downtown Houston, so we enjoyed some wine in our very nice room and watched the sunset. We were there for the Annual Heart Ball, and it was a superbly run event. We were tremendously impressed with the food, service and wine at the dinner. They served Lobster and Short Ribs as the main course, and it was as good as a meal in one of Houston's finest restaurants. A major compliment for Hotel Banquet food! One Major Issue: Hilton must own stock in a Water Softening Company! But I am going to save them more than $100,000 a year in water loss, if they will take my suggestion! TURN DOWN THE WATER SOFTENER! We both had to shower Extra-Long to even feel clean, as the excessive water softener treatment leaves a slimy, soapy feeling for a very long time. A quick 5-minute shower took more than 10 minutes, then we just gave up. Multiply that extra time per shower, times 1,200 room, time 365 nights, and you get my point. Otherwise, a true Hilton Experience and we will return!

ReviewText: In posh Houston uptown north of the Galleria, nestled (hidden really) in a thick wood of hickory and hackberry, Ponderosa pine, magnolia and iconic Texas live oaks, stands the nondescript Houstonian Hotel. The building exterior conceals the charm of this place even more than the setting. It looks more like a sprawling '70s era hospital or high school. But once you enter the Houstonian, you find yourself in what feels like a cozy, old world territorial Texan hunting lodge. Tall wainscot and stucco walls, rough-hewn ceiling timbers sporting antler chandeliers over patchwork pecan and walnut parquet, a mammoth stone fireplace, elk and pheasant and fox-hunt tapestries and bronzes all support the rustic class of the place. You'd think Sam Houston would be speaking soon from the lobby balcony (just in front of the Sitting Bull portrait). There's a quiet, friendly bar, two high-end restaurants (superb fare, but a little too high-finger for my tastes), an excellent pool grill, and attentive staff members and concierge adding to the overall Texas ritz. But the real hidden gem in the Houstonian is actually standing behind the hotel. And I'm not talking about the sprawling family-friendly pool, or the strictly regulated Olympic size lap pool, or the cozy "Quiet" pool intended for adults (though today's young bombastic families lack yesteryear's respectful decorum and invade it regularly). No. The real gem here, the amenity that vaults this place above all others is the 175,000 sq ft Houstonian Health Club, second to none in the world, the use of which is included in your hotel stay! Two stories of modern workout perfection include a yoga room, a full-sized basketball court, handball courts, a Pilates and Gyrotonic studio, a boxing gym, a power lifting studio, a smoothie and brunch cafe, an upstairs workout room nearly as large as a football field stocked with scores of every possible exercise machinery, a one-mile AstroTurf padded jogging trail circumventing the fauna and floral laced grounds, and four comfortable air conditioned indoor tennis courts (as well as seven outdoor tennis and squash courts), truly a health freak's Walhalla. We've been coming here for nearly a decade and have always had trouble finding fault with the place. Sure, the rooms are smaller than most, the bathrooms, while well appointed, are cramped, and the closets tiny. But the location, close to the Galleria and scores of some of Houstons finest restaurants, as well as parks, golf courses, Rice Village and River Oaks makes this place hard to beat. We'll be back many times in the future.

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton Houston - Energy Corridor
ProviderLocation: 11730 Katy Fwy , Houston, TX 77079-1298
ReviewText: Have stayed at this hotel numerous times and it's always fantastic! Always an easy check-in and spacious and clean suites. Love this property because all rooms are suites. The beds are fabulous and the televisions are great too. There is also lots of hot water with a great shower. The complimentary Breakfast is amazing..Best omelettes, pancakes, danish etc. The management there is top-notch… Yolanda Johnson makes you feel special during your stay, which is so appreciated! The hotel would not be the same without Yolanda there! Highly recommend this property!

ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton Houston - Energy Corridor
ProviderLocation: 11730 Katy Fwy , Houston, TX 77079-1298
ReviewText: Located in the Energy Corridor, literally stuck between two energy related corporation towers is the Embassy Suites Hotel. I am not sure if it was always an Embassy Suites from the get go, but it did not encompass the Embassy charm that I have been used to. This is not an atrium style hotel. The breakfast buffet in the morning is very similar to a stay at Holiday Inn Express. Not the type of buffet as the locations I have been to, such as the Tulsa, Ok Embassy. Parking is LIMITED. There are 2 rows of parking assigned to the hotel garage, otherwise you will hike for parking. The indoor pool is small, not resort like in nature, the hot tub is smaller too. We were out of towels the last night we were there, and when we asked the front desk twice about towels we gave up and finally just dripped to our hotel room. The pool area was trashed. The first room we were given somehow we were booked into an "accessible" room. I remember booking a King suite, so I am not sure how this happened but the showerhead leaked through the hose, it didn't hang above 5'5" and my husband is 6'8". When I called the hotel front desk, the clerk seemed put out to change our room. We were there for 2 nights. Once our room was swapped we were put in a corner room which was nice, because the windows provided the much needed lighting, the hotel room was very dark (good for sleeping, not for seeing.) There were lights out in both rooms. We had to call for our hairdryer and toiletries. Seems like they were maybe having a bad week or something. The reviews I had read made me feel like it would be a good stay. Won't book here again.
ReviewTitle: Not the typical Embassy Suites I am used to.

ReviewText: Great place to stay in Downtown Houston. Very close to restaurants and other attractions. It was an anniversary getaway even though we don't live far. ProviderName: Embassy Suites by Hilton Houston Downtown
ProviderLocation: 1515 Dallas St , Houston , TX 77010-7137 1515 Dallas St , Houston, TX 77010-7137
ReviewText: Stayed here from Thursday October 6 to Friday October 7. I had come off a Long Haul Flight from New Zealand and had one night in Houston before I continued on to Mexico. Got to IAH and took a supershuttle to the hotel, The first thing I noticed was it appeared to be on the edge of the downtown area, Next to Discovery Green which has a nice lake and parkland to walk through. I walked in and the pleasant girl behind the counter issued me Room 1003, Up I go to the 10th floor. Got into the room and it was fantastic! It really was like having your own apartment, Nice little living area with tv and snack fridge, Nice Queen size bed also with TV and VERY comfortable, Bathroom was good with Giovanni Tolietries and from memory the shower had good pressure. Truthfully my view wasn't spectacular but hey....After 24 hours in transit all I wanted was a bed! A friend of mine lives in Houston so he met me for dinner, Within just over a block walk is a Phoenicia Supermarket which also has a great little café open till late, We had dinner there and I can recommend it. We also took a walk in Discovery green which had a band playing by the lake and the restaurant looked good from the meals we could see. it took maybe 10 mins to walk into the main part of downtown but I felt safe and had no problems. The next day I woke up and checked out the pool (Very nice but not enough time to use it), Fitness centre etc. Check out went smoothly and again was polite, The only reason I took a point off is I found the walls between rooms a little thin If I'm back in Houston I'd definitely stay here again!

ProviderLocation: 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2318 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2318
ReviewText: My husband & I had a 13 hour layover in Houston, and our experience here was exceptional! This hotel is very close to the airport, and they offer free shuttle service. We waited about 20 min. for our shuttle, and the driver was pleasant, friendly & helpful! We asked if there were restaurants nearby, and he recommended the Good Eats Restaurant in the Holiday Inn . . . they even offer shuttle service to & from the restaurant! Our Server was friendly & attentive, and we received generous portions of excellent food at reasonable prices! The bread basket arrived right away . . . my husband had the chicken fried steak with loaded baked potato, and I had caesar salad, steak & loaded baked potato . . . 'just delicious! They even offer 15% discount off your meal if you mention that you're staying at the Springhill Suites Hotel. The front desk staff at the hotel was helpful, friendly & courteous! Check-in and express check-out was quick & efficient! We loved the fresh updated modern feel of our room! Our King suite was spacious and clean, comfy bed, mini fridge, coffee maker, microwave, free WIFI, great desk area with lots of plug-ins for iphone chargers, etc. The room was well designed . . .'love that the shower and sink with counter was separate from the toilet. My husband said the shower was amazing! (The rooms are also non-smoking and pet free . . . thank you!!) My only real complaint would be that the air conditioner/ fan blows cold air on you as it's located right next to the King bed. We didn't necessarily want the room colder, but wanted the fan on to try to drown out the sound of planes arriving & departing. (which is expected of an airport hotel!) We had to leave early, (before 7:00 am when breakfast is served on weekends), but were very pleasantly surprised that they put out cereal & milk by 4 am for early risers . . . thank you for that! On Friday, I asked the shuttle driver if they make trips to the airport every 30 min. . . . he said "no, just let us know when you'd like to go." But we had a different (grumpy) shuttle driver the next morning, who said "I told you we only go every 30 minutes". (That was weird, cuz we never met or spoke to this guy before!) Then the shuttle left late as they waited for other guests to show up in the lobby. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay in an excellent hotel . . . 'we would definitely stay here again!

ProviderLocation: 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2318 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2318
ReviewText: This hotel is amazing its right by the airport so that was convenient. You rarely hear the planes from the airport if so it seems very quiet. the rooms are up to date and modern very nice. The beds are comfortable to sleep in. The office people are just amazing all of them. They have breakfast in the mornings and a nice classy bar if you drink. I look forward to stay with Springhill Suites again. I give this hotel a 5 star!!!

ProviderLocation: 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2318 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2318

ReviewTitle: Overnight to flying out to SA cruise

ReviewText: what you can always expect from a spring hill suite. the front office manager, alex, took care of me by giving me a flat rate so i can stay with them. the hotel was clean and modern. I really love staying at spring hill suites.

ProviderLocation: 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2318 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2318
ReviewText: We spent two nights here while we went to the Super Bowl. The hotel is right to the airport so it was extremely convenient and meant that we avoided all traffic to and from the airport. ProviderLocation: 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2318 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2318
ReviewText: I missed a flight at Houston's Intercontinental Airport and was lucky enough to end up as SpringHill Suites. I was checked in by a lovely young lady was very nice and informed me of the amenities of the hotel. I went down to their nice breakfast in the morning where I requested and received a late checkout since my flight would not be leaving till later that evening. The room was very nice with a large flat screen TV and very clean I couldn't have asked for anything more.

ProviderLocation: 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston , TX 77032-2318 15840 John F Kennedy Blvd , Houston, TX 77032-2318
ReviewText: I'm a big Marriott fan and rarely bother to review my stays but this exceeded my expectations. ReviewText: A little difficult to find but put faith in your GPS - and keep your eyes open around all the highway construction. ProviderName: Hilton Garden Inn Houston NW America Plaza
ProviderLocation: 14919 Northwest Fwy , Houston , TX 77040-4024 14919 Northwest Fwy , Houston, TX 77040-4024
ReviewText: I have to be honest...I have really no complaints. This hotel is simply wonderful. We had a little complication after check in where the incidentals was triple charged on my card. I immediately noticed and went back to the front desk. The front desk representative Mr. Calvin Mendez who checked us in was outstanding. He graciously apologized and even called my bank and courtesy called me in my room to come down that he was fixing it. He got the bank to reverse two on the spot after speaking with me and this was at 10:30 pm. Fast forward...the room is very nice. The bed and pillows are really comfortable, the shower pressure is nice and warm, they have Neutrogena face and body products, and they have a fridge and microwave. Another plus is the Directv in the room and the HD TV channels. My favorite thing was the Keurig coffee machine in the room! They have a saltwater pool outside which I didn't explore too much this time here. They have a great fitness room and a business room with free printing. This morning we tried out breakfast. It was really good. We got the breakfast buffet at the Garden grill restaurant and it didn't disappoint. They have something for everyone. I loved that they had healthier options too such as fresh cut fruit, Splenda packets, smart butter packets, organic herbal tea, whole wheat English muffins etc. They also had your regular items such as waffle machines and pastries but they also had a full hot bar of items which was great. They had items such as eggs, sausage links, sausage patties, biscuits and gravy, breakfast potatoes, bacon, and oatmeal with toppings. They even have made to order eggs and omelettes and just so much more. This room was affordable for everything you get and I just signed up for Hilton rewards also because this experience was great. I really love all the personal touches at this hotel!!!!

ProviderLocation: 2222 West Loop S , Houston , TX 77027-3502 2222 West Loop S , Houston, TX 77027-3502
ReviewText: I have never stayed with Royal Sonesta before, so i intentionally stayed at this location and I am glad I did. I stayed on the 23rd (top) floor with Concierge Lounge access. The lounge was not staffed during the holiday season, but it was a great place to get a soda, water and snacks. My room was flawlessly cleaned and I am generally very picky. FYI parking is $22 a day for self parking in the parking garage attached to the hotel. I was fine paying the cost, but some may not.

ProviderName: Hotel Indigo Houston at the Galleria
ProviderLocation: 5160 Hidalgo Street , Galleria / Uptown , Houston , TX 77056 5160 Hidalgo Street , Galleria / Uptown , Houston, TX 77056
ReviewText: This hotel has everything the modern traveler is looking for. Guest are smack in the middle of all the Galleria area has to offer. The colors set the tone for this polished and relaxing hotel. When booking this hotel if you use a third party you will get what is available not necessarily what you need. When booking a two room suite, which is living room and a bedroom it must say just that. If it doesn't say 2 rooms it means that they are not available through the site you are on. Always put the number of people that will be in the room. If you have 4 people the hotel will know that you will need a room with 2 queen size beds. Call the hotel and make sure you are getting beds. Or you could end up with a sofa sleeper for two adults. If you are an IHG rewards member you can call IGH rewards department and let them know to add your request to your reservations, that's a perk! The Bar is quite and great location for inviting friends and colleagues for a drink or a bite to eat (parking is free). There are TV's throughout the bar/restaurant area and has great relaxing furniture. If you are wanting break included beware at booking and pay close attention before you push the button. Or just call to make sure that you're getting what you are about to pay for. A business center and Fitness center are great and all kept updated. This hotel has no pool or sun deck. But there is no much to do in the area laying out by a pool may not make your list of fun things to do in Houston. There is a policy of never say "NO" which is great as long as it is ethical and you can afford what you're asking for they will do everything to accommodate your needs. From a dozen rose to a Sunday paper. Call the hotel and ask for the best way to get transportation from the airports some taxies have been known to change as much as a 100 dollars to this hotel. It is not a 100 taxi ride, hint hint. Hotel Indigo is within 1 1/2 blocks of the Galleria and great restaurants.

ProviderName: Hotel Indigo Houston at the Galleria
ProviderLocation: 5160 Hidalgo Street , Galleria / Uptown , Houston , TX 77056 5160 Hidalgo Street , Galleria / Uptown , Houston, TX 77056
ReviewText: My favorite part about this hotel was how friendly everyone was. Every person I encountered greeted me with a smile. From the front desk staff, to the restaurant, to housekeeping, everyone was great. The hotel was very clean and well-kepmt. Hotel Indigo is also very unique looking and didn't feel like a standard chain hotel. The bedroom and bathroom were both large enough. There was a nice TV and free wifi that actually worked without having to go through repeated hassle, as is the case in some hotels. The air conditioning worked well. While not being in downtown or midtown, the location was fine with me. Downtown and midtown were a short Uber ride away, and the location seemed very calm, safe, quiet, and peaceful. There are many restaurants and a huge mall within quick walking distance. It didn't seem like there was much nightlife within walking distance, however. There was a mini fridge, but I do not recall there being a microwave in the room. That would be nice for people wanting to save some money, but I don't typically eat in on trips. I would recommend Hotel Indigo to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Houston.

ProviderName: Hotel Indigo Houston at the Galleria
ProviderLocation: 5160 Hidalgo Street , Galleria / Uptown , Houston , TX 77056 5160 Hidalgo Street , Galleria / Uptown , Houston, TX 77056
ReviewText: Room had potential, but also problems. Rooms with 'view' of Transco Tower will be blinded by morning sun. The wide slatted blinds might be trendy, but they do nothing to block the sun/heat. Also they don't properly fit the window and that adds to the issue. There is also a huge, wasted entry with a long counter and cabinets underneath. I guess that makes up for the fact there is no counter space in the large bathroom. The shower is large and nice with its own light, but the cheap detachable shower nozzle combined with no shower door doesn't allow the water to stay in the shower. There was decent water pressure, but the water doesn't get or stay very warm. I had no issue with the A/C (thankfully as it was in the upper 80's in October - yuck). My 2 main complaints about this hotel are 1) it's VERY difficult to find even with GPS - very easy to miss the entrance at night and have to drive around the block. Once you find it, the parking lot security lighting is nearly non-existent. If I hadn't prepaid my room, I would have gone elsewhere. Parking is free but that doesn't mean you should give up a secure feeling. Completely unimpressed with security because, apparently, anyone can access the hotel lobby whether or not they are a guest at any time of the day or night. The bed was very comfortable so I'll give them that one.

ReviewText: Most people think of 5* hotels as fancy and luxurious, which they usually are. What separates them from a mid-tier hotel is the service. When something goest wrong at a Marriott or Hilton, they may apologize, but do not do much to remedy the situation. In lower tier hotels, when there is an issueIf there's a negative review or complaint it usually falls on deaf ears. Conversely, there is the 4S (Four Seasons) Houston. My wife in I were in town, from California, for our godson's birthday party. This was probably our 4-5 time at the 4S, but first time in about a year. When we arrived, they were in the process of taking photos of their beautifully updated lobby and common areas, for their website. The manager politely approached my wife and I asked if we could wait a few minutes. We agreed and she offered us a complementary cocktail for our trouble. Since we do not really drink, we both declined. I then asked about the location of the restroom and another manager asked if we would be interested in having a complimentary lunch? We agreed, had a delicious lunch and I then asked for the check. The server said it was gratis and said we could order more food, cocktails, desert, etc. and that we could stay as long as we wanted. We declined and left a nice tip for our server. This is illustrative of the efforts undertaken to make sure everyone has a delightful stay. If you value service, then this is the place to stay in Houston. The Fairmont is in a great location; especially for shopping at the Galleria; however, the hotel is sort of dated. Nearly all of the common areas (lobby, lounge, bar, restaurant, pool/patio area) were updated in Feb. 2017. There are also 2 brand-new golf simulators in the lobby. The hallways and guest rooms have not been remodeled and are a little dated. I am guessing that is in the works. It is still nice. My only complaint is that our suite got quite warm at night. It had a pesky motion sensor thermostat. They are energy efficient, but if you are sleeping and do not move the air/heat shut off. Overall, I give the FS Houston 5* but if I could, I would rate it 4.5* because of the HVAC.

ReviewText: The good: Big room The bad: old, outdated rooms. Dark colored walls made the room look more ancient. Found bugs on the bed and I still have 2 nights in this place. ProviderLocation: 1100 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-3114 1100 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-3114
ReviewText: My husband and I have stayed here many times and considered it to be our favorite downtown Houston hotel for staycations. We weren't aware that they had sold, and I was disappointed in the lost "perks" and in the way these were not clearly communicated. Part of the reason we liked staying here was the complimentary wine and beer happy hour and the free breakfast. When we checked in they told us the hours for happy hour and breakfast, but failed to mention that those are no longer free. We weren't in the room long enough to use Internet, but apparently they now also charge for that! We'll be taking our business elsewhere for future staycations. Without those little perks I'd much rather stay someplace like Lancaster if I want a boutique.

ProviderLocation: 1100 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-3114 1100 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-3114
ReviewText: Let me start by saying that all the staff in this hotel are friendly and helpful. It is a beautiful hotel and the location is great for exploring the downtown area on foot. We have stayed here before and were not aware that they had discontinued the free breakfast, which was one of the main reasons we chose this hotel over others in the area. Now they offer breakfast for a charge and it is really expensive. So we went from a wonderful free breakfast to $13 pancakes. No thanks. They still have the cookies and milk at night but those are nothing to write home about. We also had a really hard time getting the business center printers to work to print our boarding passes. The staff was great trying to help but it ended up being a 45 minute ordeal. Additionally, charging for wi-fi nowadays??? I wish these high end hotels would take some cues from cheaper ones and offer free coffee and water in the lobby all day and little things like that. Overall a very nice hotel with good service, but the amenities included could be better for the price.
ReviewTitle: Great staff, used to get a lot more bang for your buck

ProviderLocation: 1100 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-3114 1100 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-3114
ReviewText: I booked this hotel using a Groupon and was so pleased. The hotel is in the former old Shell Oil building built in the early 1900's. The king bed was extremely comfortable and the room itself was nice. The valet and front desk personnel were helpful and friendly. We had reservations at a nearby restaurant for dinner and their car service took us and picked us up for free. We had a drink in the hotel bar on the 2nd floor before dinner and when we got our bill, our wine was only $4 a glass which is a steal in downtown Houston. The next morning there was extreme bad weather so we decided to wait it out before checking out and had breakfast in their restaurant. There were only 2 tables occupied, but our waiter was busy watching the weather on TV at the bar with his back to us so my husband finally went over and got his attention. We both ordered the Denver omlette which came with potatoes and fruit, but extra for toast. My husband's omlette was fine, but mine did not have any peppers and a couple of pieces of onion only and was over cooked and dry. Don't know if the waiter put the order in wrong or the cook just ran out of peppers. Was not impressed for the $13 price tag. Another negative was the valet parking fee of $36 per night. When we checked out, we noticed they were parking the cars in a lot across the street which we could have done ourselves and paid less than $36. All in all though if you are downtown for an event, it is a great location to stay in.

ProviderLocation: 1100 Texas St , Houston , TX 77002-3114 1100 Texas St , Houston, TX 77002-3114
ReviewText: We stayed at the Magnolia hotel in Houston on 2/19/2017. It was not busy at all, which I liked. When we checked in, my wife and I were the only ones in the lobby. From Valet (no self-parking owned by hotel), to check-in process, to the room... it was about 15 minutes. Valet service is pricey when compared to other boutique hotels in town. We stayed on the 6th floor. This review is based on what I observed on the 6th floor. This is a nice boutique hotel built in 1926, and remodeled in 2003 and 2009. Very nice and clean hallway. No unpleasant odors, sometimes associated with old buildings that lack maintenance, or need the carpet replaced. I am not trying to say anything bad about old building or the odors. In fact, for some hotels, that old building smells gives character and enhances its true history. The room was nice and with plenty of space. About 30 minutes after arriving to the room, I noticed a stain in the top sheet. I didn't do my usual room check upon arrival, but I am pretty sure it wasn't ours as it was already was dry. So, I just tossed the top sheet on the floor and moved on. One item I look for, is hot water. No problems there. Hot water right away. No temperature fluctuations. That is a big plus for me. Didn't go to the lounge. We went out for dinner. Didn't use the computer, so no comments on wired/wireless access. Shuttle Service: We asked for shuttle service for dinner. From hotel to restaurant, it was quick and easy. As for pick up, I called. About 15 minutes later, nothing. Still waiting for pick up. At the 15 minutes mark, I called. No answer. Two minutes later I called. stated that we were going to walk back. All I got was "OK". -- I was expecting more. When we arrived at the hotel, the shuttle vehicle was parked right in front. When we were asked why didn't we call, I stated that we did. Not much follow up after that. We only stayed one night. Bed and pillows were comfortable. We set the temperature low and called it a night. We had a nice, quiet night. This is our fourth in-town boutique hotel. Overall, this is a nice place to stay in downtown Houston. We may come back over the summer with the whole Family to check out the pool -- something my kids would like.

ProviderLocation: 4 Riverway , Houston , TX 77056-1915 4 Riverway , Houston, TX 77056-1915
ReviewText: When making my reservation, I mistook "seating area" in the description of a corner king to mean a sofa-type seating area. As my husband is a physician, we sleep separately because he receives phone calls all through the night, a chair next to the bed wouldn't suffice for our needs. I called the front desk and was told that sadly there were no suites available. The assistant front desk manager (I wish I remembered his name) phoned the room not ten minutes later to tell me that he had located a guest who would not be needing his suite for the evening. He then sent the bellman with the new keys and to help with my bags; the room was just down the hall a few doors. The suite was beautifully decorated, very comfortable, and exactly what we needed. He then sent up a lovely cheese tray with a hand written note. I was more than pleased, excellent customer service.

ProviderLocation: 4 Riverway , Houston , TX 77056-1915 4 Riverway , Houston, TX 77056-1915
ReviewText: Let me start off by saying that the only redeeming quality for this trip was the NON-MANAGERIAL staff at the front desk because they were truly sincere, and the spa. Before the trip, I called the hotel to make special arrangements since this was our three-year anniversary. Upon check-in, I asked if the special arrangements (flowers arranged in a heart with our initials in the middle, red bull, a FULL bottle of vodka, and orange soda) were done. I was told that they were not sure if they were done and that if they weren’t, it would be complete during evening turn-down service. I had no problem with that as we had our spa appointment shortly after check in. Upon returning from the spa, there were no flowers and I found a bottle of tonic water and a SHOT of vodka. As we were leaving the hotel on our way to our anniversary dinner, I stopped by the front desk and respectfully communicated my dismay at the lack of professionalism towards accommodating personal requests for special occasions. I was offered either free drinks or free breakfast for my troubles and I said no as either did not work with our itinerary for our anniversary weekend. I was told that because I booked the hotel through a discount website I could not be refunded or comped even a portion of the cost of the stay. I was instead told that if I wanted to make things right, I could pay for another night and allow them to do it right. Since it was our anniversary and believing that the hotel management would make it right, I paid for another night (WHICH I NOW SEVERELY REGRET). After we returned from dinner, we found that the flowers were laid out. That only added insult to injury. Upon calling the hotel before returning to make sure that everything was in place, I was told that due to “security reasons” I could not be provided a full bottle of vodka (even though I was willing to pay for it) and was instead provided with two mini-bar bottles and instead of a 2-liter of orange soda I was given a personal bottle. I have stayed at many hotels for special occasions and this was the first hotel out of many to tell me I could not be provided a full bottle of alcohol. Since we decided to stay another night, we decided to try out their “club”. Before explaining how the manager made my wife cry, I would like to explain this. We are state employees and as such we are issued government IDs. When the manager examined her state ID (because she left her license at home by accident). He said “how do I know that this is not an employee ID” I showed him the holo-pad and her DOB. He then stated “How do I know this is not an issue date? (the ID does not specifically state that the date shown is her DOB) He then said “This ID is not acceptable. Goodbye”. He then walked off which is beyond unacceptable for hospitality management. I would understand refusal or not listening if we were at a liquor store, but we were guests at this hotel so it was completely uncalled for, for him to not even listen to us. I would also like to point out that HER ID WAS ACCEPTED AT TWO OTHER BARS THE SAME NIGHT. If the issue date was her DOB, one she’d be older than 21 and two, he insulted my wife by insinuating that she was nearly 30 years older than her age. She was so upset she cried nearly an hour after returning to the hotel room. What makes this even worse was, if he was that truly concerned, there is a 24-hour hotline (which is on the back of the ID) that can be called to confirm we are who we say we are. But of course, this manager was completely unprofessional and walked away before we could explain. This anniversary was nothing but a nightmare and the best part of the trip was being able to leave such a rude and unprofessional hotel. If I could give this hotel a 0, I would. Side note: I was TABC certified so I know what I am talking about. TABC allows establishments to choose which ID is or is not acceptable. However, we were not at a standalone bar (which we got into two of those before we came back to the hotel as stated earlier) we were at a HOTEL WHERE HOSPITALITY AND PROFESSIONALISM IS EXPECTED EVEN FROM MANAGEMENT. Had the manager been courteous and professional (INSTEAD OF CONFRONTATIONAL) when he denied us, it would not have been upsetting.

ReviewText: We chose to stay at St Regis Houston for a wedding, rather than the lower cost option provided. Having stayed at the St Regis Atlanta before, I was looking forward to another grand experience. We checked in right before 5pm on a Friday. We settled in our room and were out by 6pm for an evening on the town. When we returned at 11pm, our room had not been serviced for turndown. (and no, we didn't have a privacy sign on the door) This meant no ice, no bottled water. I wasn't interested in calling down to request since it was so late. I mentioned it to the front desk the next morning and they didn't seem the least bit concerned, and asked if I wanted it that night (well of course I do, I wouldn't be bringing it up otherwise). Things like this shouldn't slip through the cracks at a hotel of this level. Other than that, the hotel is nice enough in all other areas. Great bar with live music on Saturday night. Towncar service to the Galleria was quick and easy. Certainly not the crown jewel of St Regis properties, but one of the nicer options in the Houston area.
ReviewTitle: A nice option for a weekend in Houston, but......

ReviewText: My recent trip to Houston entailed stay an unexpected night since the evening lasted longer then anticipated and was too tired to drive. I happen to pass by The Westin and thought why not take a look at the rates. To my shock, it was very reasonably priced for how gorgeous this hotel looked. The gentleman working the desk on the night of July 9th was very professional and courteous, I don't remember his name but extreme props to him. Checkout time is noon, I asked if there's any availability could I have something potentially later without an extra cost and he was able to push my time back a some. I was greatly appreciative for him doing that; I had literally been up for over 24 hours at that point. It was 2 o'clock in the morning when I checked in and I never felt my safety compromised. I chose self parking at $14 a day and the lot was very secure. You swipe your room key and a actual gate plus control arm opened and allows you to enter. Upon entering my room, it had a very fresh smell and everything was in place. The sheets had not a wrinkle and were about as tight as military standards; I could probably bounce a quarter on them. The white linens, towels and comforter were bright and not faded. I had a room on the 18th floor facing a skyline of downtown Houston, the view was amazing. The room is elegant with modern features. On the 18th floor there was also a gym and pool, both having full views of the sky line. In summary, I would highly recommend this hotel. Anytime I return to Houston in the future, this will be one of the first places I look at while booking.

ReviewText: Very nice hotel, lots of parking. Initially you may experience that the hotel is difficult to find because it is somewhat set back on I-10 feeder road. Traveling from west to east on -10, take the Dairy Ashford exit. The hotel is located on your right, just after you pass through the traffic light signal at Dairy Ashford Rd. You will most likely see the Holiday Inn Express sign first, as it is the taller sign. The Hilton Garden Inn sign is a shorter sign, just below the Holiday Inn sign. Therefore, take the driveway at the Holiday Inn Express sign, and you will see the Hilton Garden Inn set back a little further! Another note: You can adjust the softness/firmness of your bed mattress because they have sleep-number type beds!

ReviewText: I had a quick night stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. Overall, it was a very good night stay. I didn't use any of the amenities so I can't comment about that. Location - there is a lot within a short driving distance but not much around it. Fyi, It looks like they are building some other Hotels and/or Apartment buildings right around the corner. Thus, during my stay, there was a lot of construction nearby which wasn't the most appealing. Overall location, below average rating for places within walking distance but above average rating for places nearby, if you don't mind driving a a couple of miles. Front desk/checkin - it was very quick. They had my keys ready and had me on my way in a minute or two. But, it wasn't the most inviting reception. I got a hi, may I have your ID/credit card, and here are your keys. That was about it. Usually they at least go over the amenities or give you a little more information about the hotel. I wasn't even told how to get to the room. Odd. Amenities - I didn't use any of them. I did see a bar and a little restaurant by the front desk as well as a small outdoor pool on the side of the hotel. Room - it was quite spacious but felt the decor was a little outdated. It had a microwave and refrigerator which was useful. The bed seemed a little hard but still comfy (of course beds are all subjective). I did hear some noise but wasn't sure where it came from. Maybe the hallway or maybe someone next door? By about 9/10pm it got pretty quiet. The a/c was cool but annoyed me when it was turned on. It was blowing the drapes open and letting light in which was particularly annoying at 6 in the morning! The bathroom was big but some reason I was given a handicap accessible room. Overall, it was a good stay. Oh course I got a great rate so can't complain that much! If you want to be close to City Centre and save a little bit of money, this is a good option.
